title: BRIT Awards 2017: Charlotte Crosby and Holly Hagan arrive

text:
They've been known to hit the town in barely-there ensembles during their time on Geordie Shore .
And Charlotte Crosby took inspiration from her time on the MTV show, while Holly Hagan kept it more demure as they arrived in style at the BRIT Awards 2017 on Wednesday night.
Charlotte, 26, oozed sex appeal as she flashed her underwear in a raunchy figure-hugging leopard print dress, while Holly, 24, went uncharacteristically reserved in a stunning black gown.
Sexy arrival: Charlotte Crosby looked racy in a skin-tight leopard print dress, while her former Geordie Shore co-star was uncharacteristically demure in a black gown for the BRIT Awards 2017 on Wednesday
Charlotte clearly had no issue flaunting her sensational curves in the skin-tight number which bared her undergarment.
Her sex-kitten look was teamed with a cascading mane of effortlessly blow-dried curls, which framed her smokey eyes and heavily contoured cheekbones.
The stunner, who is the ex girlfriend of former Geordie Shore co-star, teamed the look with a pair of towering stilettos and chic black clutch.
Meanwhile, Holly opted for a surprisingly classier look in the form off her bardot style figure-hugging black gown which flared out into a fishtail.
All eyes on her: Charlotte clearly had no issue flaunting her sensational curves in the skin-tight number which bared her undergarment
Take a walk on the wild side in Charlotte Crosby's leopard print dress £130 Rat & Boa Valentina Dress
Get it now!
Buy now
Charlotte Crosby ensured all eyes were on her on the red carpet at this years Brit Awards, wearing a sheer leopard print maxi dress over nothing but a pair of black knickers. She then accessorised her look with strappy sandals and a leather clutch.
We applaud Charlotte's courage to wear this statement look and we do reckon it goes with the Brits signature off-beat and eccentric appraoch to red carpet dressing.
Charlotte's dress is from Rat & Boa and is available to buy online now for £130! Follow the link on the right to snap it up or for more choice shop around with our edit of alternatives in the carousel below.

Glamorous: Her sex-kitten look was teamed with a cascading mane of effortlessly blow-dried curls, which framed her smokey eyes and heavily contoured cheekbones
Here she comes: The brunette made her presence felt during a glamorous night out at BRITs
Going wild: Charlotte's striking leopard print dress ensured she stood out on Wednesday night
Looking good: The former Geordie Shore star's curves were on display as she made her way across the red carpet
Holly worked her curves in the striking frock as she posed alongside her racier pal.
The reality sensation, who quit Geordie Shore in December, draped a statement choker style necklace around her neck, which complemented the Quote: tattoo on her decolletage.
She opted for a dark vampy lip and purple eye shadow, while sporting old-school Hollywood waves.
The duo took to social media to show off their sensational looks before arriving at the BRITs, with Charlotte oozing sex appeal in a full-length snap.
Holly shared a much more closer picture of them two, which flaunted their striking make-up look.
Elegant: Holly opted for a surprisingly classier look in the form off her bardot style figure-hugging black gown which flared out into a fishtail
Wow: The duo took to social media to show off their sensational looks before arriving at the BRITs, with Charlotte oozing sex appeal in a full-length snap
Pair of stunner: Holly shared a much more closer picture of them two, which flaunted their striking make-up look
The 37th BRIT Awards ceremony features a star-studded line-up with Katy Perry, Ed Sheeran, Robbie Williams, Little Mix, Bruno Mars, The 1975, Emeli Sandé and Skepta all taking the stage.
Emma Willis and Dermot O'Leary present the show after being drafted in when Michael Buble was forced to pull out due to his son's battle with cancer.
'The BRITs is an iconic show that I've watched and attended many times,' said Dermot about his hosting duties. 'It's a holy grail for a broadcaster, and I'm really looking forward to working with Emma, who I'm a big fan of, and celebrating a brilliant year of British music.'
'To present the BRITs is an honour but to be doing it alongside one of my absolute favourites, Mr Dermot O'Leary is just bonkers. Bring on the BRITs 2017,' added Emma.
